title: Drawing, Candelabrum as part of a decoration, 1480–1500
title_raw: Candelabrum as part of a decoration
medium: Pen, ink, brown watercolor, white heightening on red colored paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Vertical rectangle. Cut along the outlines of the drawing. Supported by a blossum and two lion feet. The lower part has the shape of a pedestal, shown from one corner, the plan being above angular, below circular. Rising rinceaux are in the panels, in tho

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Candelabrum as part of a decoration, 1480–1500. Pen, ink, brown watercolor, white heightening on red colored paper. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-6780
